policies.name: Physical Security Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing physical access to facilities containing CUI systems
policies.rationale: NIST 03.10.01 requires 'develop, approve, and maintain' a list of authorized individuals, necessitating formal policy governance for physical access control

policies.name: Physical Access Control Policy
policies.description: Policy defining authorization criteria, credential types, and access review requirements
policies.rationale: Control requires 'issue authorization credentials' and periodic reviews, requiring policy-level guidance on credential management

procedures.name: Physical Access Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for requesting, approving, and granting physical access to facilities
procedures.rationale: Control requires systematic process to 'develop, approve, and maintain' authorized access lists

procedures.name: Authorization Credential Issuance Procedure
procedures.description: Process for issuing, tracking, and deactivating physical access credentials (badges, cards, keys)
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'issue authorization credentials for facility access'

procedures.name: Facility Access Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review of facility access lists and removal of unauthorized individuals
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'review the facility access list' at organization-defined frequency and 'remove individuals from the facility access list when access is no longer required'

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Facility Access List Reviews
executionEvidence.description: Review reports showing: current authorized individuals, access justifications verified, terminated/transferred employees removed, reviewer signatures, date completed
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires periodic review; quarterly aligns with typical personnel change cycles and industry best practices

executionEvidence.name: Authorization Credential Issuance Logs
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: individual name, credential type (badge/card/key), issue date, authorization approver, return date for deactivated credentials
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates execution of credential issuance requirement for each authorization

executionEvidence.name: Access Removal Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: individual name, termination/transfer date, credential return date, access removal confirmation, removal approver
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires 'remove individuals from the facility access list when access is no longer required' - timely execution is critical for security

executionEvidence.name: Current Facility Access Authorization List
executionEvidence.description: Master list showing: all authorized individuals, roles, access levels, authorization dates, review dates, approvers
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires maintaining current list; must reflect recent changes within one business week

physicalEvidence.name: Physical Access Credentials Inventory
physicalEvidence.description: Inventory of all physical access devices: badge numbers, key numbers, assigned individuals, issue dates, locations controlled
physicalEvidence.rationale: Supports credential management requirement by documenting all physical access devices in use

physicalEvidence.name: Facility Security Plan
physicalEvidence.description: Plan documenting physical locations containing CUI systems, access control points, authorization levels, and credential types
physicalEvidence.rationale: Defines scope of 'facility where the system resides' and authorization requirements per NIST discussion

operationalActivities: Request physical access authorization with business justification
Review and approve access requests based on role and need
Issue authorization credentials (badges, cards, keys) to approved individuals
Maintain current list of all individuals with facility access
Review facility access list quarterly to verify continued need
Remove individuals from access list immediately upon termination or transfer
Collect and deactivate credentials from individuals no longer requiring access

policies.name: Physical Security Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing physical security monitoring and incident response
policies.rationale: NIST 03.10.02 requires 'monitor physical access' and 'respond to physical security incidents', necessitating policy-level guidance

policies.name: Physical Security Incident Response Policy
policies.description: Policy defining physical security incident detection, response, and investigation procedures
policies.rationale: Control requires 'detect and respond to physical security incidents' which requires formal incident response governance

procedures.name: Physical Access Monitoring Procedure
procedures.description: Process for continuous monitoring of facility access using guards, cameras, sensors, and access control systems
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'monitor physical access to the facility' - procedure defines monitoring methods and responsibilities

procedures.name: Physical Access Log Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review of physical access logs to identify suspicious activities and anomalies
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'review physical access logs' at defined frequency and upon specific events

procedures.name: Physical Security Incident Response Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for responding to physical security incidents including investigation and remediation
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'respond to physical security incidents' - procedure defines response actions and escalation

executionEvidence.name: Monthly Physical Access Log Reviews
executionEvidence.description: Review reports showing: review date, time period covered, anomalies identified, suspicious activities investigated, corrective actions taken, reviewer signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires periodic log review; monthly frequency balances security monitoring with resource efficiency

executionEvidence.name: Physical Security Incident Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports documenting: incident date/time, location, description, individuals involved, detection method, response actions, resolution, lessons learned
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates execution of 'detect and respond to physical security incidents' requirement

executionEvidence.name: Video Surveillance System Maintenance Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: maintenance date, systems checked, issues identified, repairs completed, operational status verified
executionEvidence.rationale: Supports monitoring capability by ensuring video surveillance equipment remains operational

executionEvidence.name: Event-Based Log Reviews
executionEvidence.description: Special reviews triggered by specific events: after-hours access, repeated failed access attempts, unusual access patterns, emergency events
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires review 'upon occurrence of organization-defined events' - timely review critical for incident detection

physicalEvidence.name: Physical Access Audit Logs
physicalEvidence.description: Automated logs from badge readers, access control systems showing: date/time, individual, location, access granted/denied, door sensor status
physicalEvidence.rationale: Primary monitoring evidence for 'monitor physical access to the facility' requirement

physicalEvidence.name: Video Surveillance Footage/Logs
physicalEvidence.description: Video recordings and system logs from cameras covering facility entry/exit points and sensitive areas
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly mentions 'video surveillance equipment (i.e., cameras)' as physical access monitoring example

physicalEvidence.name: Security Guard Logs
physicalEvidence.description: Guard shift logs documenting: observations, visitor interactions, incidents, rounds completed, anomalies noted
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly mentions 'guards' as physical access monitoring method

physicalEvidence.name: Physical Access Sensor Logs
physicalEvidence.description: Logs from motion sensors, door sensors, intrusion detection systems showing activation events and system status
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly mentions 'sensor devices' as physical access monitoring example

operationalActivities: Monitor physical access control systems continuously during operating hours
Review video surveillance footage for suspicious activities
Conduct security guard rounds and document observations
Review physical access logs monthly for anomalies
Investigate after-hours access and repeated access to unusual areas
Respond to physical security incidents within defined timeframes
Document and analyze physical security incidents
Maintain and test physical monitoring equipment monthly
Review access logs immediately upon detection of triggering events

policies.name: Telework and Remote Work Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing alternate work site approval, security requirements, and contingency operations
policies.rationale: NIST 03.10.06 requires 'determine alternate work sites allowed' and 'employ security requirements at alternate work sites', necessitating formal policy governance

policies.name: Physical Security Policy for Alternate Sites
policies.description: Policy defining physical security requirements for work conducted at non-organizational facilities
policies.rationale: Control requires 'organization-defined security requirements' for alternate sites - policy establishes these requirements

policies.name: Contingency Operations Policy
policies.description: Policy addressing use of alternate work sites during contingency operations and emergencies
policies.rationale: NIST discussion states 'alternate work sites can provide readily available alternate locations during contingency operations'

procedures.name: Alternate Work Site Approval Procedure
procedures.description: Process for requesting, evaluating, and approving alternate work site arrangements
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'determine alternate work sites allowed for use by employees' - systematic approval process needed

procedures.name: Alternate Work Site Security Assessment Procedure
procedures.description: Process for assessing security controls at alternate work sites including physical security, network security, and CUI handling
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'employ security requirements' - procedure ensures requirements are met through assessment

procedures.name: Remote Work Incident Reporting Procedure
procedures.description: Process for employees to report security incidents occurring at alternate work sites
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states 'providing a means to communicate incidents at alternate work sites supports contingency planning activities'

executionEvidence.name: Approved Alternate Work Site List
executionEvidence.description: List showing: employee names, approved alternate work site addresses, work activities permitted, approval dates, security requirements applicable, approval authority
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates execution of 'determine alternate work sites allowed' requirement

executionEvidence.name: Annual Alternate Work Site Security Assessments
executionEvidence.description: Assessment reports showing: site location, security controls verified, deficiencies identified, corrective actions required, assessment date, assessor signature
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion requires 'assessing the effectiveness of the requirements' - annual reassessment ensures continued compliance

executionEvidence.name: Alternate Work Site Security Agreements
executionEvidence.description: Signed agreements from employees acknowledging: security requirements, CUI handling restrictions, physical security responsibilities, incident reporting obligations
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: N/A - maintained for duration of arrangement
executionEvidence.rationale: Documents employee understanding and acceptance of 'organization-defined security requirements'

executionEvidence.name: Remote Work Security Incident Reports
executionEvidence.description: Incident reports from alternate sites showing: incident date/location, description, CUI impact, response actions, lessons learned
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates 'means to communicate incidents at alternate work sites' per NIST discussion

physicalEvidence.name: Home Office Security Checklists
physicalEvidence.description: Completed checklists documenting: secure workspace setup, physical access controls, CUI storage measures, network security controls, privacy protections
physicalEvidence.rationale: Validates physical security requirements at private residences used as alternate work sites

physicalEvidence.name: Alternate Site Security Requirements Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documents defining specific security requirements for different types of alternate work sites: home offices, satellite offices, temporary locations
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion states 'organizations can define different security requirements for specific alternate work sites or types of sites'

operationalActivities: Request approval for alternate work site arrangements
Assess security controls at proposed alternate work sites
Approve or deny alternate work site requests based on security requirements
Sign security agreements acknowledging alternate work site requirements
Implement required security controls at alternate work sites
Conduct annual security assessments of approved alternate work sites
Report security incidents from alternate work sites promptly
Update alternate work site approvals when work activities change
Revoke alternate work site approval when security requirements cannot be met

policies.name: Physical Security Policy
policies.description: Comprehensive organizational policy governing physical access control systems, devices, guards, and procedures
policies.rationale: NIST 03.10.07 requires multiple physical access controls including 'enforce physical access authorizations', 'escort visitors', 'secure keys', and 'control physical access to output devices'

policies.name: Visitor Management Policy
policies.description: Policy defining visitor access procedures, escort requirements, and visitor activity restrictions
policies.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'escort visitors, and control visitor activity'

policies.name: Key and Credential Management Policy
policies.description: Policy governing issuance, storage, tracking, and auditing of physical access keys, combinations, and credentials
policies.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'secure keys, combinations, and other physical access devices'

procedures.name: Physical Access Control Enforcement Procedure
procedures.description: Process for verifying physical access authorizations and controlling ingress/egress using access control systems, devices, or guards
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'enforce physical access authorizations at entry and exit points' through 'verifying individual physical access authorizations' and 'controlling ingress and egress'

procedures.name: Visitor Management Procedure

procedures.name: Physical Access Audit Log Management Procedure

procedures.name: Key and Credential Control Procedure

procedures.name: Output Device Access Control Procedure
procedures.description: Process for controlling physical access to printers, copiers, scanners, and other output devices to prevent unauthorized CUI access
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'control physical access to output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining access to CUI'

physicalEvidence.description: Documentation of access control system configuration: entry/exit points covered, authentication methods used, authorization levels defined, integration with badge systems

policies.name: Physical Security Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing physical protection of network infrastructure and transmission lines
policies.rationale: NIST 03.10.08 requires 'control physical access to system distribution and transmission lines', necessitating policy-level guidance for infrastructure protection

policies.name: Network Infrastructure Security Policy
policies.description: Policy defining security requirements for physical network infrastructure including cabling, distribution frames, and wiring closets
policies.rationale: Control addresses safeguarding system distribution and transmission infrastructure from physical threats

procedures.name: Wiring Closet Access Control Procedure
procedures.description: Process for controlling and monitoring access to wiring closets, telecommunication rooms, and network distribution areas
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion mentions 'locked wiring closets' as safeguarding measure for controlling physical access to transmission lines

procedures.name: Network Infrastructure Protection Procedure
procedures.description: Process for implementing and maintaining physical safeguards for cables, conduits, distribution frames, and junction boxes
procedures.rationale: Control requires physical access control to distribution and transmission lines - procedure defines implementation methods

procedures.name: Network Infrastructure Inspection Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic inspection of physical cabling infrastructure to detect tampering, damage, or unauthorized access
procedures.rationale: NIST discussion states safeguarding measures 'prevent accidental damage, disruption, and physical tampering' - inspection validates effectiveness

executionEvidence.name: Wiring Closet Access Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: date/time accessed, individual identity, purpose of access, work performed, physical verification of lock status, supervisor approval for maintenance
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates controlled physical access to network distribution areas housing transmission lines

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Network Infrastructure Inspection Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: inspection date, locations inspected, cable protection verified, locked closets confirmed, tampering evidence checked, deficiencies identified, corrective actions taken
executionEvidence.rationale: Validates effectiveness of physical access controls and safeguarding measures for transmission lines

executionEvidence.name: Cable Protection System Maintenance Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: conduit inspections, cable tray maintenance, wiretapping sensor tests, physical protection repairs, maintenance date, technician signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly mentions 'cabling protection with conduit or cable trays' and 'wiretapping sensors' as safeguarding measures

executionEvidence.name: Network Infrastructure Diagram Updates
executionEvidence.description: Updated diagrams showing: wiring closet locations, cable routes, physical protection measures, access control points, last update date
executionEvidence.rationale: Maintains current documentation of physical infrastructure requiring access control

physicalEvidence.name: Wiring Closet Physical Access Logs
physicalEvidence.description: Badge reader or lock logs from all telecommunication rooms and wiring closets housing network distribution equipment
physicalEvidence.rationale: Primary evidence for 'control physical access' to locations containing system distribution and transmission lines

physicalEvidence.name: Cable Protection Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documentation showing physical safeguards implemented: conduit specifications, cable tray installations, locked enclosures, junction box security
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly lists 'cabling protection with conduit or cable trays' as safeguarding measures

physicalEvidence.name: Network Infrastructure Physical Security Assessment
physicalEvidence.description: Assessment documenting physical vulnerabilities of transmission lines: exposed cables, unsecured junction points, accessible distribution frames, physical tampering risks
physicalEvidence.rationale: Validates implementation of safeguarding measures to 'prevent accidental damage, disruption, and physical tampering' per NIST discussion

physicalEvidence.name: Wiretapping Detection System Documentation
physicalEvidence.description: Documentation of wiretapping sensors or intrusion detection devices protecting sensitive transmission lines
physicalEvidence.rationale: NIST discussion explicitly mentions 'wiretapping sensors' as safeguarding measure for transmission line protection

operationalActivities: Control and restrict access to wiring closets and telecommunication rooms
Lock all wiring closets and network distribution areas when unoccupied
Install and maintain physical cable protection (conduits, trays, covers)
Disconnect or lock unused network jacks and ports
Inspect network infrastructure quarterly for tampering or damage
Install and test wiretapping detection sensors on sensitive lines
Document all authorized access to areas containing transmission lines
Maintain current diagrams of network infrastructure and protection measures
Repair or replace damaged cable protection systems promptly
Investigate any evidence of physical tampering with transmission lines
